article_sub_title: Navigating the UK's Stablecoin Consultation Framework
content:
The UK is taking significant strides toward regulating stablecoins, with the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and the Bank of England (BoE) spearheading this initiative. The recent publication of the FCA’s Consultation Paper CP25/14 outlines the proposed regulatory framework for the issuance and custody of qualifying stablecoins, emphasizing the need for robust safeguards to enhance public trust.

Key elements of the proposed framework include:

  • Defining "qualifying stablecoins" to ensure financial stability.
  • Implementing strict custody standards to protect consumer assets.
  • Considering temporary ownership limits, proposed at £20,000 for individuals, to mitigate systemic risks.

As the consultation process unfolds, feedback from industry stakeholders will be crucial in shaping a balanced regulatory environment that fosters innovation while maintaining financial integrity.
